title: Official Blind Review #3
review_assessment:_checking_correctness_: I did not assess the derivations or theory.
review:
This work proposed to use Graph Laplacian spectrum to learn graph representation. Its isomorphism invariance, expressiveness and deformation consistency is analyzed. Based on graph perturbation, the representation capacity of GLS is analyzed; bounds are derived for the distance between the GLS of two graphs; lastly experiments are conducted on multiple datasets to validate the proposed graph representation. 

After reading the paper, my biggest concern lies in the fact that the proposed graph representation does not outperform the existing approaches, especially on the social network datasets. 

For easier reading,  it is better to mark the best performers in the results tables in bold or color.
